Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a pale-orange pottery vessel, the interior is slightly grooved and spotted with a black resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a cream-coloured slip and remains of at least four lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393264) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393264)
